Title: Data Analyst - Early Collections
Description:
At ING we are looking for a Data Analyst ‚Äì Early Collections







Your role and work environment:




We are looking for a talented and enthusiastic Data Analyst ‚Äì Early Collections to join our Collections Expert Unit, Team of Easy Financing Tribe.




The responsibility of this team is to make the difference by being customers‚Äô partner in times of financial difficulties, while protecting bank interest and our way of working is Agile.




Your key responsibilities:




As an Data Analyst Early Collections, you will:




Positively contribute to the team responsible for delivering a high-quality early collections service.

Co-create and lead

the strategy and the roadmap to achieve the best-in-class collections services

the precise and safe execution of the operational processes and automated collections workflow configuration in the Collections Tool

the external collections agencies coordination and monitoring, iv) the evolution towards a more data driven and digital service.




What are we looking for?




Want to know if this job is made for you? These are some of the qualities that we value the most for this role. And if the shoe fits‚Ä¶ don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




Expertise in managing collections services, amicable and legal collections services, for direct portfolios or third-party services, for more than 3 - 5 years.




Degree in Economics, Business, Math or Engineering (bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in).

Proficient knowledge of Excel and SQL. Other programming languages such as SAS/MicroStrategy/Power BI would be welcome.

High Level of English.




Expertise in the banking industry, expertise or technical knowledge in collections software management or experience in digital collections will be valued.




What do we offer?




The time you spend at work, the challenges you face or the lessons you get are very important, but‚Ä¶ What about your personal life? At ING we want your work to fulfill you in every way, and that is why we take care of even the smallest details.




Check out what is waiting for you!




Be flexible my friend.

Our model is all about flexibility and accountability. Keeping both our customers and our colleagues needs in mind, you determine together which days you work at home and which you come to ING MAD to offer your best self. Do your thing.

Restaurant card.

So that thinking about what to have for lunch doesn‚Äôt take up your time or your cravings.

Our house will be your home.

In our offices you can find electric mobility solutions, doctor, hairdresser, gym, The Good Service (to help you with your errands) and much more!

Health insurance.

For you and all your family (spouse/partner and children).




Life insurance.

We help you protect what matters most to you.

Flexible remuneration.

In addition, you will enjoy our flexible remuneration model, through a more tax-advantaged way, you will be able to access other services such as nursery, transport card, training aids‚Ä¶

Free company shuttle.

It doesn't matter where you live. We have 6 routes (North, Central, South, A5, A42 and A6) to get you to our ING office in Madrid comfortably.

Banking benefits.

Special loans with more beneficial conditions.

Special mortgage conditions after 6 months working at the bank.

And you can benefit from our pension plan after 1 month with us!

More vitality and more belonging

360¬∫ care of the employee (physical, mental, financial, and social).

Health services in company (physiotherapy, phycological and medical services).

Orange sports (football, basket, running, golf, gympass ‚Ä¶).

Employee Networks: Rainbow Lions (LGBTQI+) & Leonas.







Get to know Us




We are a team of more than 1600 people sharing one idea: doing our bit in helping our clients create a better future for themselves, by providing them with the tools they need to get where they want to go.




A fully online bank where technology, innovation, simplicity and transparency are the main ingredients, and the first one to work with agile methodologies.




And although we are based in Spain, we are lucky to work in an international bank with presence in more than 40 countries.




We are proud to have a diverse team and we are committed to continue developing a culture of Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging to foster a culture of collaboration and innovation that represents all collectives in the society.




And even though we look orange on the outside, we are green on the inside. Our ambition in Sustainability is Empowering (y)our Sustainability journey. We are embarking on our path, for us, but we are also there for when our clints decide to embark on this journey.




Making things happen, helping others be successful, always being one step ahead‚Äîthat‚Äôs our DNA. If you look at yourself in the mirror and your reflection matches our way of being and working‚Ä¶we are looking forward to meeting you!

Title: Digital Data Analyst
Description:
Estamos buscando un Digital Data Analyst para el equipo Customer Insights para trabajar en el √°rea de Digital en Desigual. La funci√≥n principal ser√° el desarrollo, an√°lisis, mejora y mantenimiento de dashboards que ayuden en analizar y comprender el negocio.




¬øQu√© te ofrecemos?




4-day work-week: trabajamos 34 horas dentro de una semana laboral de 4 d√≠as para potenciar la creatividad y la conciliaci√≥n. Adem√°s, contamos con flexibilidad horaria de entrada y salida.
Oficinas abiertas al mar: estamos en la Barceloneta frente al Mar Mediterr√°neo. Las vistas nos inspiran y el entorno nos permite disfrutar de una vida saludable: hacer deporte, llegar en bicicleta o caminando o comer al aire libre.
Podr√°s flexibilizar tu salario destin√°ndolo a servicios como seguro de salud, transporte, guarder√≠a y comida. Adem√°s, podr√°s disfrutar de caf√©, infusiones y fruta fresca cada d√≠a.
Desigualiza tu armario: tendr√°s un 50% de descuento en nuestras colecciones.




Tus funciones principales ser√°n‚Ä¶




An√°lisis de M√©tricas Digitales: Recopilar, limpiar y analizar datos de diversas plataformas digitales (Google Analytics, CRM, etc.) para medir el desempe√±o del negocio y las diferentes campa√±as.
Optimizaci√≥n del LTV del cliente: Analizar el comportamiento de los usuarios para identificar puntos de fricci√≥n y oportunidades de mejora en la experiencia de usuario.

Title: Data Analyst - 100% Remote
Description:
We are looking for the very Top Talent‚Ä¶and we would be delighted if you were to join our team!

More in details, UST is a multinational company based in North America, certified as a Top Employer and Great Place to Work company with over 35.000 employees all over the world and presence in more than 35 countries. We are leaders on digital technology services, and we provide large-scale technologic solutions to big companies.




What are we looking for

We are looking for Data Analyst who will contribute to a project with one of our global customers.




Your main responsibilities include:

Lead data model analysis initiatives, especially in the context of a data migration.

Must be able to investigate and propose data mapping solutions to fulfil target data models.

Key player on conversations with data Quality, data Owners and data Stewards, as well as Subject Matter Experts

Must be able to support test cycles to clarify doubts and resolve incidences.

Progress reporting to senior management




What are we looking for?

4yrs working experience as a Data Analyst

Experience in analysis and design of data collection systems.

Track record of developing high quality analysis that has resulted in successful data model definitions and migrations.

Maintains internal and external relationships ensuring compliance in all activities.

Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy.

Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.

What can we offer?

23 days of Annual Leave plus the 24th and 31st of December as discretionary days!
Numerous benefits (Health Care Plan, teleworking compensation, Life and Accident Insurances).
Retribuci√≥n Flexible¬¥ Program: (Meals, Kinder Garden, Transport, online English lessons, Health Care Plan‚Ä¶)
Free access to several training platforms
Professional stability and career plans
UST also, compensates referrals from which you could benefit when you refer professionals.
The option to pick between 12 or 14 payments along the year.
Real Work Life Balance measures (flexibility, WFH or remote work policy, compacted hours during summertime‚Ä¶)
UST Club Platform discounts and gym Access discounts




If you would like to know more, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply and we‚Äôll get in touch to fill you in detail. We are waiting for you!

In UST we are committed to equal opportunities in our selection processes and do not discriminate based on race, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation or nationality.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us :

As the European market leader, NEXTLANE develops and delivers digital solutions for the automotive industry by connecting the systems of manufacturers and dealers.

We develop integrated end-to-end software and digital solutions that digitize and simplify the entire automotive customer journey.

Our mission is to empower our clients to boost their business operations and optimize their customer experience through innovative solutions. Our comprehensive software suite revolutionizes every aspect of new and used vehicle sales and management.







üìã Context of the Position :

Primary function is to collect, analyze, and interpret data to help the company make informed and strategic decisions. Use data analytics tools to examine trends, patterns, and correlations that can influence business performance.




Work closely with other departments to identify areas for improvement and opportunities to optimize processes and increase operational efficiency. Develop reports and presentations that clearly and concisely communicate the results of the analyses to senior management and other key stakeholders.




The role reports directly to the Chief of Staff of the CEO, topics are then very diverse and exposition to senior leadership is a given.







üéØ Your responsibilities :

As a key member of our team, you'll be responsible for...




Collect and analyze data related to the automotive sector, including sales data, inventory, marketing, and other key performance indicators.
Identify trends and patterns in data to provide valuable insights to product development and marketing teams.
Create clear and concise reports and presentations to communicate findings to management and other departments.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to improve data-driven decision-making.
Develop and maintain predictive models and data analysis to enhance operational efficiency and increase company profitability.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and optimization based on data.
Stay updated on the latest trends and technologies in data analysis and apply them in the company.







üïµÔ∏è What we are looking for :




Experience:

Bachelor's degree in statistics, mathematics, computer science, or a related field.

Experience and skills in data analysis is a must have

Experience and skills in data science and AI is a nice to have




Languages:

Fluent level of English

Professional competency in French is a nice to have




Technical Skills:

Statistics, databases and information systems.

Professional level of Excel and PowerBI (or similar)

Advanced knowledge of data analysis tools (SQL, R and Python‚Ä¶) is a nice to have

Any knowledge of automation or data platform tools (DBT,Alteryx, Knime, Make, Snowflake, Databricks‚Ä¶) is a nice to have




Soft Skills:

Ability to work independently and in a team.

Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Ability to manage multiple projects and meet established deadlines.







ü§ù Our Recruitment Process:

30-minute call with our Talent Acquisition Specialist.
Two interviews with our Hiring Managers to evaluate your technical and soft skills.




Join us and be part of the Nextlane adventure that is shaping the future of the automotive industry!







üíé Our Advantages

We value flexibility and trust within our corporate culture, offering benefits that reflect our commitment to our teams:

üè° Possibility to telework up to 3 days a week!

ü§ù ‚Ç¨600 referral bonus for each talent you capture. (after the 6-month trial period).

üç± Flexible Remuneration (COBEE).

üë© ‚öïÔ∏è Medical Insurance (Adeslas).

üìí Access to a dedicated internal training platform for continuous learning.

üå¥ 23 days of vacation. Intensive day July and August.







ü§ù Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging:




We are committed to enabling everyone to feel included and valued in the workplace. We believe that the company and its culture are strongest when they are made up of diverse experiences and backgrounds.

We welcome applications from people with disabilities. If you are a person with a disability and need help, please let us know so we can talk about how we can best support and make any adjustments that may be necessary.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of age, color, family, gender identity, marital status, national origin, physical or mental disability, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws.







üåç What does it mean to work at Nextlane?




Join a young and fast-growing company, where you can work on new and ambitious projects.

International and multicultural environment.

Collaboration between colleagues.




We truly believe that Nextlane is a great place to work and develop your talent! Sign up for our offer and find out why.

HTML:
About us :

As the European market leader, NEXTLANE develops and delivers digital solutions for the automotive industry by connecting the systems of manufacturers and dealers.

We develop integrated end-to-end software and digital solutions that digitize and simplify the entire automotive customer journey.

Our mission is to empower our clients to boost their business operations and optimize their customer experience through innovative solutions. Our comprehensive software suite revolutionizes every aspect of new and used vehicle sales and management.



üìã Context of the Position :

Primary function is to collect, analyze, and interpret data to help the company make informed and strategic decisions. Use data analytics tools to examine trends, patterns, and correlations that can influence business performance.


Work closely with other departments to identify areas for improvement and opportunities to optimize processes and increase operational efficiency. Develop reports and presentations that clearly and concisely communicate the results of the analyses to senior management and other key stakeholders.


The role reports directly to the Chief of Staff of the CEO, topics are then very diverse and exposition to senior leadership is a given.



üéØ Your responsibilities :

As a key member of our team, you'll be responsible for...


  • Collect and analyze data related to the automotive sector, including sales data, inventory, marketing, and other key performance indicators.
  • Identify trends and patterns in data to provide valuable insights to product development and marketing teams.
  • Create clear and concise reports and presentations to communicate findings to management and other departments.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to improve data-driven decision-making.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About us




We are a multinational food company that conserves the goodness of nature in our products. We carefully select our fruit and vegetables from their origin, maintaining the highest quality and safety throughout the production process.




We pride ourselves in providing consumers with natural, healthy, and nutritious products that have made us a reference in infant and adult nutrition. In addition, the Hero Institute of Infant Nutrition is within the Hero Spain facilities.




Website: www.hero.es




Sector: Food company




Company size: More than 4,000 employees




Headquarters: Lenzburg, Switzerland




Company type: Private company




Categories: Baby food, Healthy Snacks, Natural Spreads, Sauces, Juices and Nectars, Cereal Snacks, Prepared meals




What is our commitment?




We are on a mission to delight consumers by conserving the goodness of nature. The world today is different from what it was 10 years ago, and nothing like it was in 1886 when Hero was founded in Lenzburg, Switzerland. However, our core goals remain the same. We have adapted to change, offering consumers high quality, healthy, natural and sustainable food.




Hero Spain, with its headquarter in Alcantarilla (Murcia), has formed part of this legacy since 1922. We are committed to naturalness in our products, maintaining a firm nutritional commitment and constantly improving thanks to our commitment to continuous innovation and research, to adapt to the needs of consumers, customers, and new market trends.




Team value proposition




Recently, Hero Spain has been certified as a #TopEmployer in 2023 and 2024 üèÜ, an achievement that reflects our ongoing commitment to the well-being and development of our team of talents. This recognition is a testament to the exceptional culture we have cultivated together, positioning us as one of the best companies to work for in Spain. This would not have been possible without the commitment and dedication of every person who is part of the Hero family.




We don't hire top talent so we can tell them what to do. That doesn't make sense. At Hero, we give you the opportunity to make your mark and contribute to something bigger. We‚Äôll give you the tools and skills to do your job and then get out of the way.




Purpose




We are on a mission to conserve what's good in nature. We do so by striving to conduct our business sustainably and striving to do the right thing. Always. Without compromises.




Values

The new values reflect the company today and the company we want to build in the future. Values are at the heart of who we are as people and they guide how we behave.




Create wow

We dare to do things differently, seek to always win with consumers and customers, and endeavor to be forever relevant and vital to our world. It‚Äôs about Curiosity, Innovation and Consumer/Customer Focus.

Everyone Hero

We work together in pursuit of our common mission and strategy, strengthening our local businesses by leveraging the power of the collective. It‚Äôs about Purpose, Performance and Teamwork.

Nourish others

We treat everyone with honesty, care and respect and provide our people, customers and consumers with what they need to thrive. It‚Äôs about Honesty, Empowerment, Respect and Diversity.

Take responsibility

We make good choices today to build a more sustainable business and environment fit for the needs of tomorrow. It‚Äôs about Sustainability, Ownership, Heritage and Quality.




Impact




We value good ideas, so we want the best talent. Our people can make a difference because we give them the freedom to act, to be entrepreneurial, and to make a difference. This is reflected in the responsibilities. Be yourself, be impactful.




Growth




We all win if we grow together. It's about professional and personal growth. The best way to grow as a company is to help you grow as a person, hence the availability of learning and development opportunities.




Meet you future department




The Finance department owns the financial close process and produces financial statements and reports to guide strategic decision-making.




How can you help us?




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.




Your main responsibilities




Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.




Academic Background




Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.




Skills and competences




Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into meaningful information, as well as representing it in graphical and visual reports.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Results-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.




Others




Based in Spain




What do we offer you?




(Confidentiality is assured)

During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.




Benefits

Hybrid work
Flexible Schedule and early finish on Fridays, also during summer months
Attractive Compensation & Benefits package
Physiotherapist
Continuous learning and development
Ongoing feedback
Collaborative and challenging multinational environment
Strong values
Matrix organization
Open and transparent culture
Great work environment
Amazing people
and much more!




Would you like to join us?




If you what to know more about Hero, access our web site: www.hero.es

If you want to dive into our commitment to sustainability, access our 2023 Annual Report.

How can you help us?

Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.


Your main responsibilities


  • Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
  • Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
  • Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
  • Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
  • Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
  • Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
  • Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.


Academic Background


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
  • Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
  • Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.

  • Hybrid work

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!




WHO WE ARE

Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.

We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.




KEY FIGURES

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers

2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth

2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers

2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market




YOUR CHALLENGE

You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations
You will get full ownership of our contextual data to offer insights and communication strategies to our most relevant clients
You will present your results internally and externally, co-creating contextual strategies with big clients (from Nissan to Coca-Cola, Heineken, Tag Heuer, etc.)
You will help us build contextual tools that would allow the democratization of data inside the company: from sales, to marketing, to operations, the different teams should be using contextual data in their day-to-day
Some experience building extract, transform, load (ETL) data pipelines will be needed here.
You will analyze performance of our current Contextual products and actively proposing improvements together with the Product Team
Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!




YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF

You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!




It would be a big plus if you

Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders




SEEDTAG PERKS

üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities

üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)

‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life

üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses

üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)

üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.

üèã Gympass




BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG

Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject "that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.




Are you ready to join the SEEDTAG adventure? Then send us your CV!

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
‚ö°Do you dare to lead the digital transformation to create a more sustainable world? üå≥




At Schneider Electric, we are the leading digital partner in sustainability and efficiency for businesses, communities, and individuals. Our goal is for all people to be able to make the most of our energy and resources through the integration of processes, software, Big Data, and energy technologies that enable integrated management of buildings, industries, and cities. We are present in over 110 countries with a diverse and disruptive team of over 150,000 people. If you are seeking an opportunity to propel your career and challenge your creativity, we want to meet you!




We are currently seeking for a Marketing Data Analyst to our new Sales & Marketing Insights & Analytics team. You will be working for the Nordic Baltic Zone and based in our office in Barcelona, Spain.




In this role you will be joining us on our exciting journey towards a more sustainable future. You will be responsible for interpreting data and turning it into insights to provide our commercial organization with in-depth analytics and actionable recommendations to drive our commercial performance forward as we aim to be the best performing Sales & Marketing organization in our industry. You are eager to understand and learn about the business and commercial organization and you animate the Nordic Baltic Sales & Marketing organization with analytics, insights and actions within fields such as Marketing Campaign Performance, Digital Marketing Performance and Digital Product Experience Performance.




What will you do?

You will be working in a newly established team of minimum five Marketing Business Analysts working together with Marketeers, Channel Mangers, Offer Managers, Business developers and other colleagues both locally but also globally. You will play a critical role in supporting business decision making processes by providing insightful analysis and financial evaluations. Your outputs will be critical in order to help the business make decisions, support strategies and to optimize profitability and this position will involve a wide blend of commercial data analysis, financial modelling and market research.

Responsibilities include:

Business Interpretation

Acting as a critical link between the data delivered by the technical teams and the data consumed by the business to support the business to be able to make data driven decisions to enhance go-to-market performance

Data Analysis

Gathering and structuring information from various sources
Making recommendations about the methods and ways in which we obtain and analyze data to improve quality and efficiency of data systems, dashboards etc.
Identifying patterns and trends in data sets and analyze results

Result Analysis

Working alongside teams within the business including management team to establish business needs
Collecting and interpreting data to improve our commercial processes
Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business
Designing Data for dashboards serving business needs




What qualifications will make you successful for this role?

We believe you enjoy having a constant focus on both quality and performance excellence. You thrive in a changing environment, you are curious, willing to learn and not afraid to ask questions. As you work closely with internal and external colleagues from across Schneider‚Äôs global organization it is essential that you have the intercultural curiosity it takes to build relationships across borders. We are looking for a person with:




Several years of experience supporting multinational and multicultural work environments across Europe in using data science techniques to generate valuable insights and analytics to support the company's partner performance and commercial efforts
A dynamic individual & role model that inspires & influences our stakeholders in equal measure and has strong analytical and problem-solving skills
A relevant degree such as Masters degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, Marketing, Data Science or equivalent
Effective communicator capable of interaction with different stakeholders including senior management
Fluent in English and preferably in one or more of the Nordic languages




As a Data Analyst you should be experienced in:

Project management
Data models and reporting packages
Collecting and analyzing large dataset from various sources
Analyzing results and identifying patterns and trends in data sets like Sales and Opportunities pipelines, customer segmentation and engagement data etc.
Creating data visualizations and reports to effectively communicate findings
Collaborating with cross-functional teams to establish business needs and develop new data collection and analysis processes
Maintaining and ensuring the accuracy and integrity of data incl. data cleaning and data preparation
Staying up-to-date with industry trends and developments to continuously improve data analysis methods
Understanding of partner relationship dynamics and financial modeling expertise
Knowledge of e-commerce platforms and analytics
Data analysis tools and software like Excel, Tableau, SEMrush, Google Analytics, ContentSquare, SimilarWeb etc.




While also having:

Attention to detail
‚ÄúCan-do‚Äù and positive attitude to challenges and opportunities
Ability to prioritize and execute tasks efficiently under pressure
The ability to make data-driven decisions and visualize them in an easily understandable way
A strong verbal and written communication skills
An analytical mind and inclination for problem-solving
Effective teamwork and collaboration skills




Our benefits:

To help you stay energized, engaged and inspired, we offer a wide range of benefits and so you can relax, recharge and be there for the people you care about.

We seek out and reward people for putting the customer first, being disruptive to the status quo, embracing different perspectives, continuously learning, and acting like owners. We want our employees to reflect the diversity of the communities in which we operate.

Schneider Electric is an equal opportunities employer. We welcome people as they are, creating an inclusive culture where all forms of diversity are seen as a real value for the company. We‚Äôre looking for people with a passion for success ‚Äî on the job and beyond.




Why us?

At Schneider Electric we're committed to creating a workplace that gives you not just a job but a meaningful purpose in joining our mission to bring energy and efficiency to enable life, progress and sustainability for all.

We believe in empowering our team members to reach their full potential, fostering a sense of ownership in their work.

We embrace inclusion as a fundamental value, ensuring that every voice is heard and valued. We value differences, and welcome people from all walks of life. We believe in equal opportunities for everyone, everywhere.

If you want to be part of a company where your contributions truly matter, where you are empowered to make a difference and where inclusivity is valued, we would love to hear from you.

At Schneider Electric, we are the leading digital partner in sustainability and efficiency for businesses, communities, and individuals. Our goal is for all people to be able to make the most of our energy and resources through the integration of processes, software, Big Data, and energy technologies that enable integrated management of buildings, industries, and cities. We are present in over 110 countries with a diverse and disruptive team of over 150,000 people. If you are seeking an opportunity to propel your career and challenge your creativity, we want to meet you!


We are currently seeking for a Marketing Data Analyst to our new Sales & Marketing Insights & Analytics team. You will be working for the Nordic Baltic Zone and based in our office in Barcelona, Spain.


In this role you will be joining us on our exciting journey towards a more sustainable future. You will be responsible for interpreting data and turning it into insights to provide our commercial organization with in-depth analytics and actionable recommendations to drive our commercial performance forward as we aim to be the best performing Sales & Marketing organization in our industry. You are eager to understand and learn about the business and commercial organization and you animate the Nordic Baltic Sales & Marketing organization with analytics, insights and actions within fields such as Marketing Campaign Performance, Digital Marketing Performance and Digital Product Experience Performance.


What will you do?

You will be working in a newly established team of minimum five Marketing Business Analysts working together with Marketeers, Channel Mangers, Offer Managers, Business developers and other colleagues both locally but also globally. You will play a critical role in supporting business decision making processes by providing insightful analysis and financial evaluations. Your outputs will be critical in order to help the business make decisions, support strategies and to optimize profitability and this position will involve a wide blend of commercial data analysis, financial modelling and market research.

Responsibilities include:

Business Interpretation

  • Acting as a critical link between the data delivered by the technical teams and the data consumed by the business to support the business to be able to make data driven decisions to enhance go-to-market performance

Data Analysis

  • Gathering and structuring information from various sources
  • Making recommendations about the methods and ways in which we obtain and analyze data to improve quality and efficiency of data systems, dashboards etc.
  • Identifying patterns and trends in data sets and analyze results

Result Analysis

  • Working alongside teams within the business including management team to establish business needs
  • Collecting and interpreting data to improve our commercial processes
  • Reporting the results back to the relevant members of the business
  • Designing Data for dashboards serving business needs

  • Knowledge of e-commerce platforms and analytics
  • Data analysis tools and software like Excel, Tableau, SEMrush, Google Analytics, ContentSquare, SimilarWeb etc.


While also having:

  • ‚ÄúCan-do‚Äù and positive attitude to challenges and opportunities

  • The ability to make data-driven decisions and visualize them in an easily understandable way
  • A strong verbal and written communication skills

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of AON, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




About the role




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with visibility to real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.




A typical day




Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through skillful data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal stakeholders.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various stakeholders that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.




What you need to succeed




About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.




About the recruitment process




Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the leaders from our amazing Data Analytics Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Analyst as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level on SQL and you will have a maximum of 4 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet




At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure‚Ä¶




üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
üçè Great office in Madrid, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Data Visualization Analyst (Multinacional)
Description:
En VISEO nos diferenciamos por la participaci√≥n en proyectos innovadores de soluciones Cloud, usando tecnolog√≠as Microsoft, l√≠deres en el mercado y donde actualmente somos Partners y aportamos m√°s de 490 certificaciones.

Esta es una gran oportunidad para formar parte de una multinacional presente en los 5 continentes como Data Visualization Analyst.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are

Quantion is a Business Digital Transformation services company born in 2015.




We have +120 professionals in application development, UX/UI and digital business transformation to build innovative solutions oriented to business results.




As a Digital Factory we combine our teams in cutting-edge technologies and digital deep experiences with the innovation ecosystem, to ensure that we can provide the best solution to face business challenges, from its concept to its implementation.




We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Technology team. If you want to participate in one of our biggest International projects, don‚Äôt hesitate to apply!




What you will do:

You will be responsible for designing, developing and maintaining data collection architecture, reports, metrics and analyses for different teams
You will juggling all kinds of data, collect and analyze them and seek for patterns and trends to drive the digital acceleration and future customer experience
You will utilize big data and business intelligence technologies to shape and drive key business decisions.
You'll make analysis results accessible by building and providing dashboards and reports based on business needs
You closely align with business and management teams to assess business needs
You collaborate with the product teams to identify possibilities for improvement and adaptations regarding their digital products
You will work pragmatically and support my team to deliver high quality solutions with speed
You will work in an international environment with a diverse team
You will work in an international environment with a highly diverse team




Required skills:

At least 2 years of experience as a Digital Analyst
Experience in working in cross-functional teams in an agile environment
Knowledge of software-development processes, dependencies and digital products as well as methodologies and frameworks like Scrum and Kanban
Knowledge of databases (e.g., SQL, NoSQL‚Ä¶), reporting tools (e.g. , Tableau) and cloud platforms (esp. Microsoft Azure)
Ambition to master and not being intimidated by unstructured data and large datasets
Willingness to expand my comfort zone by sometimes leaving it
Very good command of English language







Apply to our offer‚Ä¶

üíü If you are passionate about technologies

üíü If you define yourself as a team worker

üíü If you want to work with a multidisciplinary and international team

üíü If you want to be part of a company which is permanently expanding and growing

üíü If you want to work in an international environment




Our offering:

‚ú® Permanent contract

‚ú® Competitive salary

‚ú® 22 days of vacation

‚ú® 5 additional holidays for Christmas

‚ú® 4 additional holidays for Easter

‚ú® Flexible working time

‚ú® Continuous working days in summer




Committed to equality, at Quantion we believe in diversity and inclusion. We defend equal opportunities without discriminating based on gender, age, religion or sexual orientation or any other aspect that could be considered exclusive.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At EA, we thrive on outrageous thinking. It‚Äôs the fuel that inspires the best games in the world. We‚Äôre innovators and great storytellers. But it‚Äôs not just about amazing your peers, it‚Äôs about amazing yourself. Take risks. Collaborate with great minds and dare to dream big. Do you want to come with us? Together, we are changing the way millions play every day.

EA inspires the world to play, and the Worldwide Localization Team makes that happen! We are accountable for delivering the high-quality localized versions of our titles to over 30 countries around the world. You will find a vibrant, multicultural environment with a great mixture of professionals. From software engineers, project managers, testers to audio, text and linguistic specialists, each employee has an important role to play. EA has built a cutting-edge Localization powerhouse that covers the needs for both current and next-generation platform

Are you a dedicated and experienced Data Analyst looking for an exciting opportunity to join a dynamic team? We are seeking a talented individual to become a key player in our Loc Data & AI team at Electronic Arts (EA). This role is pivotal to our data-driven decision-making process, where you will analyze data to uncover insights that enhance our gaming.

Responsibilities


Data Analysis: Analyze complex data sets to identify trends, patterns, and correlations.
Visualization: Create compelling data visualizations and reports that effectively communicate findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Usability: Design and develop user-friendly dashboards, reports, and tools to facilitate data-driven decision-making.
Storytelling: Craft compelling narratives to convey complex data insights and recommendations to various audiences.
Ownership: Deliver end-to-end data projects, from initial data requirements gathering and validation to final analysis and presentation.
Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams to integrate data insights into business strategies.
Data Quality: Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with organizational standards.
Tool Development: Develop and maintain tools, scripts, and documentation to support data analysis and visualization.


Qualifications And Skills


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a relevant field with relevant experience or a Master‚Äôs degree.
A minimum of 5 years of experience in providing valuable insights that have demonstrably enhanced outcomes.
Excellent level of English.
Technical Proficiency:
Microsoft Power BI: Expertise in Power Query M, DAX, dataset modeling, reports, and dashboards design, with the ability to design prototypes to support requirements.
APIs: Understanding of REST APIs and SOAP APIs, with the ability to read and understand technical specifications.
Data Analysis and SQL: Strong expertise in data analysis and SQL programming.
UX/UI Design: Sound knowledge of UX/UI design for analytics solutions.
Version Control and CI/CD: Proficiency with Git and CI/CD (multi-branch approach).
Soft Skills:
Teamwork: Strong team worker with a delivery-focused mindset.
Agile Experience: Experience working within Agile teams.
Stakeholder Communication: Ability to articulate conversations with business stakeholders beyond the technical level discussion of the user stories.
Communication: Robust communication skills, with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Strategic Thinking: Strong strategic and problem-solving skills, with the ability to anticipate potential issues and create effective solutions.
Exceptional ability in data visualization and design, with a focus on crafting compelling data narratives.
Mastery in leveraging Business Intelligence tools to drive data analysis and strategic decision-making.


Connect your future to ours. Inspire. Dream. Play

Title: BI Analyst - Data Visualization
Description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

Fever is looking for an Analyst that will play a vital role in taking our products to the next level, deepening/ widening our current understanding of our users and identifying improvement opportunities for our product. We're looking for someone with great analysis skills, the ability to get things done and a genuine interest in our customers.

This is the perfect position for someone who knows a variety of techniques and tools related to data analysis (examples of techniques: SQL, clustering, predictive models, pattern recognition, examples of tools: R, Google Analytics, Mixpanel, etc), enjoys working in a team and loves digging into data to uncover product/business problems and opportunities. You will work closely with different areas of the business. We also value the ability to understand how to prioritize, think on how things will scale, make tradeoffs and balance the business needs with technical constraints .

Key Responsibilities


Create new visualizations according to all Fever teams needs and new requests
Optimize and maintain all those visualizations
Fully understand Fever's data model to be on top on new visualization requests and study their viability
Fully understand existing visualizations for all teams to be in charge of responding doubts and new requests via the corresponding channels for each team
Be proactive to create new visualizations and to improve our existing data model
Understand our data hierarchy and security levels for each team


Basic Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree with Engineering/Technical background required.
+2 years of experience in MicroStrategy, only experience with MicroStrategy will be considered (no other visualization tools).
Strong analytical and quantitative skills; strong bias towards data-based decision.
To love everything data - designing models, reporting, driving results/growth
Excellent written and spoken English
Good time management skills.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with developers, business owners, and senior business leaders.
High sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.


Preferred Qualifications


Top-tier grades
An excellent understanding of SQL or other query languages preferred
Experience in a cross-functional team.
Experience working in agile software development is a plus


BENEFITS


Attractive compensation package
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of the city, with possible travel across our markets
Home-office friendly
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English Lessons and Gympass
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
We have free snacks, drinks and fruit at the office!


Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age, or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

Title: Graduate Data Analyst
Description:
Descripci√≥n





Calling all Graduates! Are you looking for an opportunity to kickstart your career with industry leading training and mentoring? If so, then look no further‚Ä¶

We‚Äôre looking for Graduate Business Data Analysts to join our two-year Graduate programme, giving you experience working in a FTSE 100 listed software company.

Everything we do at Sage is designed to help business flow, to help business‚Äô make decisions faster and more accurate. As part of this, we rely on our team of experts to create, develop and maintain industry leading products. And that‚Äôs where you come in!

We‚Äôre on the hunt for our future top talent who can bring their skills and expertise to continue to drive us forward.

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Data is at the heart of everything that Sage does, and the BI and Analytics Hub works horizontally across Sage to make sure we use data and insight to deliver our purpose to knock down barriers and create connections and opportunities for customers and colleagues. The BI and Analytics Hub supports designated teams to become a franchise, enabling them to produce value-driven data products, enhancing Sage‚Äôs capabilities in business intelligence and analytics to advance Sage‚Äôs overall data strategy.

You will work closely with a wide range of stakeholders to define and translate business needs in to project and data requirements. You‚Äôll perform data analysis and create visualisations using data storytelling techniques, using your skills to contribute to various success factors such as revenue and cost reduction, productivity savings, reduction of risk and contribution to our ESG agenda.

Throughout the 2-year Graduate programme and your career at Sage, we want you to be enthusiastic about your personal development, and continuously learn new things to strive for excellence. We expect a lot from our Graduates and will encourage you to bring innovative ideas to add real value for our customers, in an environment where ambition for future progression is rewarded.

Responsabilidades principales What are we looking for?

You‚Äôll need to be a Graduate, and whilst we‚Äôre open to any degree discipline, you‚Äôll need to be business minded, ideally with project management or process improvement understanding.

Alongside this, you‚Äôll also have


A keen eye for detail and an inquisitive mind to help problem solve.
You‚Äôll be resilient and determined, able to work in a fast paced, changing environment.
As part of a global business, you‚Äôll be an effective communicator, able to collaborate with people from across the world.
Adept at requirement gathering and the ability to collect, organise and disseminate large amounts of data.
Able to present data and explain complex analyses in a clear manner.






These roles are based in Barcelona. You‚Äôll be in the office at least 2 days a week so will need to live in (or be willing to relocate to) an easily commutable distance.

Why you would love to join us?


Great salary and performance annual bonus
We take great pride in offering a comprehensive and structured development program, which includes engaging weekly training sessions designed for our Sage Ignite graduates.
Diverse and Inclusive Work Environment, at Sage we are proud in encouraging a collaborative and inclusive workplace that celebrates diversity. Our Barcelona office is a vibrant multicultural environment, representing over 23 nationalities.
We offer work-away program where employees have the chance to work from various locations around the world, this benefit is great way to enhance your professional experience and promote a global mindset.
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge projects and technologies.
Community: Make a difference to communities we live and work in, with your 5 volunteer days every year. How we are making a difference






https://www.sage.com/en-us/company/sage-foundation/


Continuous Development: Unlimited access to Linkedin Learning and Sage University.






Career Growth: Long-term prospects for a professional career. Access to Talent Marketplace, an internal system that uses artificial intelligence to create a clear path for growth.


Brand office space, locates at the heart of Barcelona‚Äôs 22@tech district, with great transport links.
Reduced working hours on Fridays and in the summer (July and August).
Flexible benefits that suit your needs.






What you can expect from the process:


Apply online with CV
Complete screening and video interview (You will receive a link to complete a video interview from the Outmatch platform)
If successful at video interview stage, you will be invited to attend an assessment centre in the summer (the first week of September).
Successful candidates will join us on 1 October 2024






Please note that due to the high volume of applications, there will be a delay in receiving a response from your video interview. We thank you for your patience.

Here at Sage, we are committed to inclusivity for all, so if there any adjustments that would help you thrive in the application process or beyond, please reach out to us at earlycareers@sage.com

Apply today!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Who we are




At CoverWallet we are determined to revolutionize the insurance industry! We launched in 2015 and since then we are the leading digital platform for contracting insurance for small and medium-sized companies. Thanks to state-of-the-art technology and meticulous design we have turned insurance management and processing into a simple, fast and convenient process for our clients. All online, in minutes!




Our passion is in delivering innovation and value creation through technology, and our mission is to become the world‚Äôs leading InsurTech. For this, we have built an incredible team of ~800 people based in New York, Spain, Poland and Singapore. Success is guaranteed as we are part of AON, the global leaders in risk, retirement and health solutions with 50,000 colleagues worldwide. We combine the mindset and culture of a high-growth startup with the backing and support of a global multinational. The best of both worlds in one company - what more could we ask for?




About the role




As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for building robust analytical platforms to support data-driven initiatives across the company. In this role, you will deliver strategic analysis on high priority initiatives across the entire organization. You will be working closely with Product, Marketing, Sales, and Operations in providing them with visibility to real-time data. You will be expected to deliver data-driven insights that will play an integral role in defining the company‚Äôs data model.




A typical day




Use Looker to build critical dashboards that will measure business performance, hold teams accountable, and generate insights.
Democratize data through skillful data structuring by developing Looker explores to support our internal stakeholders.
Own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various stakeholders that will be utilized to make strategic decisions for improvements.
Partner with the Analytics and Data Engineering teams to understand current problems with our existing data platform, identity solutions, and deliver high quality data foundations to data stakeholders across multiple business lines.
Work cross-functionally with Product, Sales, Operations, and Marketing to provide them with visibility to real-time data on existing and new processes.




What you need to succeed




About 2 - 4 years of experience in a data analyst role.
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in a quantitative field.
Highly proficient in SQL
Experience using visualization tools, preferably Looker, Tableau, or Power BI.
Experience working in Agile environments, preferably with Jira.
Extra Credit - Exposure to data modeling and transformation tools like dbt and experience with data analysis and building data pipelines with Python.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.
Problem solver with excellent analytical skills.
Hability to work in a fast-paced environment.
Comfortable working on multiple projects simultaneously.
Strong quantitative reasoning skills and experience using data to provide insights to executive leadership and other departments.




About the recruitment process




Your first contact with CoverWallet will be through an HR interview with one of our colleagues from the Talent Acquisition area, who will tell you everything about our company and its history, as well as the details of the position, functions and your future conditions. We would love to know your professional and academic career, and of course, your motivations and expectations for a new professional project. We will be happy to answer all your questions!
Do we have a match? Let‚Äôs move on to your First Technical Interview! You will meet two of the leaders from our amazing Data Analytics Team, who will explain to you in more detail what the team's day-to-day and their responsibilities. They will be very interested in expanding information about your experience as a Data Analyst as well as your knowledge of our main technological environments.
If everything has gone well and you have impressed our colleagues... we advance to the second stage of the process! We will send you a data challenge based on a case study to find out your technical level on SQL and you will have a maximum of 4 days to complete it.
If you've made it this far, things are getting interesting... It's time for your Final Interview! In this case, you will have the opportunity to meet our Head of Data, who will close the selection process with an interview aimed at getting to know you not only on a professional and technical level, but also on a personal level, so that both of you can reach the conclusion of whether the purpose of our project fits with your professional aspirations.




Why CoverWallet




At CoverWallet you will have the opportunity to be a key player in the transformation of one of the largest industries and in one of the most developed digital markets in the world. You will work in a cutting-edge tech environment, alongside a super powerful and diverse global team. Join us and build your own career plan in one of the world's leading companies, tailored to your dreams and aspirations. And just for good measure‚Ä¶




üí∞ Competitive salary based on your background and experience, and a variable annual bonus set according to your goals
‚è∞ Enjoy flexible working hours and find out your ideal way of working thanks to our smart work model: full remote or hybrid, it‚Äôs up to you!
üéÅ Perks package consisting of a Company-paid Life, Accident Insurance and Medical Cover with free dental care. Complement your benefits with our flexible compensation plan (tickets restaurant, transport card, daycare checks, external training and even a Pension Scheme!)
üìö Carry on with your training thanks to your additional budget of 1,500‚Ç¨ per year to finance training courses, certifications, books or any teaching aids that will help you continue to grow professionally
üõí Enjoy a lot of offers and save on your purchases thanks to our discount platform on your favorite brands (travel, fashion, technology, leisure...)
üèù 23 paid vacation days per year, plus 2 additional personal days and 2 wellbeing days to focus on your own health and prioritize self-care :)
üçè Great office in Madrid, where you will find all the coffee, drinks, snacks and fruit you want. Come and enjoy all the activities we do, both inside and outside the office (hackathons, meetups, tech talks, code katas and much more!)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
If you have a passion for technology and thrive on innovative and diverse projects, you've found your ideal destination. If you don't know us yet, we are a global technology provider that offers a complete portfolio of solutions in Payment, Mobile and Identity Solutions. With a rich history spanning 65 years of global experience, we have built a solid legacy that continues to grow. Comprising over 4,000 dedicated professionals across 16 countries, we collaboratively work towards creating a more trustworthy and secure world.




Our vertical offers solutions for the Telecommunications market, such as SIM Cards, eSIMs, Subscription Management, iSE, to secure connectivity and guarantee interoperability, connecting people, companies, and objects efficiently and with secure processes.




We are actively seeking a passionate Data Analyst ready to embark on a journey of continuous learning and professional growth with us. This role will be based in Madrid where you would play a crucial role in the Analyse of Data and optimize operational processes to increase efficiency and reduce costs across various departments.




The ideal candidate will have experience in data engineering as a Data Analyst, Business Analyst, Operations Business Analyst or Business Process Analyst or similar role




Key job responsibilities:




Analyse and optimize operational processes to increase efficiency and reduce costs across various departments.
Develop and implement business performance metrics to measure productivity and identify areas for improvement.
Coordinate with IT departments to implement and improve business systems and software tools.
Facilitate cross-functional team projects to streamline operations and enhance collaboration between departments.
Prepare detailed reports on business operations and present findings to senior management for strategic decision-making.
Design and execute operational audits to ensure compliance with industry regulations and internal policies.
Investigate and resolve operational issues, providing solutions to prevent recurrence.
Research and recommend new technologies or methodologies to improve business operations and competitive advantage.




If you want this position to be yours, we would like you to have the following:




Graduated in Systems Engineering, Computer Science, Programming and/or Related Studies with Data Analysis, Business Intelligence, Machine Learning or related field
Experience in Telecom (Desirable)
Excellent level of English, both verbally and in writing is a must.
Skills in Chinese or native chinese will be a plus
Knowldege of programming skills in languages such as Python, Java, SQL.
Strong skills in PowerBI
Knowledge in Atlassian Tools (JIRA, Confluence, etc.)
Knowledge in Power Automate / Office 365 Structure
Familiarity with cloud platforms such as Microsoft Azure or AWS
Knowledge in standards as ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 27001, GSMA SAS-UP, CMMI V3.0 (Desirable)
Knowledge in Microsoft Dynamics (Desirable)
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.
Strong communication and collaboration skills.




What do we offer?




Join our team Valid by entering into technological and innovative projects within multicultural and multidisciplinary teams.
Flexibility. We have flexible hours and possibilities of working from home to improve the work-life balance of our employees.
We care about your well-being. You will have private medical insurance
Do you need a break? You will find our cafeteria at your disposal




If you believe this opportunity is a good fit for you, please either apply through LinkedIn or send your application to: hrtalent@valid.com




Join this great team and be part of our story!




Valid creates an inclusive environment for all employees. We are committed to building a company that reflects the diversity of the world that means fighting for equal opportunities based on a responsible and inclusive management of its human team with actions as non-discrimination concerning sex, age, race, sexual orientation, religion, education, social status, culture, or special needs such as illness or disability.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Overview




Keysight is on the forefront of technology innovation, delivering breakthroughs and trusted insights to the world's visionaries and innovators in electronic design, simulation, prototyping, test, manufacturing, and optimization. Our ~15,000 employees create world-class solutions in communications, 5G, automotive, energy, quantum, aerospace, defense, and semiconductor markets for customers in over 100 countries. Our technical solutions - and our methods for creating them - help connect and secure the world. Learn more about what we do and how we do it.




Our powerful culture has led to us being independently recognized on Fortune 100's Best Companies List and we are "Great Place to Work" Certified. We're driven, collaborative, ethical, and curious, and we value all ideas, especially bold ones. And our culture extends far beyond our own walls. Our corporate social responsibility efforts support our communities, nurture the next generation of engineers, and promote environmental sustainability.




At Keysight, Inclusion, Equity & Diversity is an integral part of our core values. We believe that when people feel a sense of belonging, they can be more creative, innovative, and thrive at all points in their careers. We believe everyone should be respected in the workplace and in their communities regardless of race, color, age, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, ethnicity, religion, disability, veteran status, national origin, or any protected class. We continuously challenge ourselves to grow in our understanding of inclusion by engaging in a wide variety of diversity programs, initiatives, employee network groups and mentoring/development. This is Keysight - People and Culture - YouTube

Responsibilities

Keysight Global Marketing (KGM) is hiring a Marketing Data Scientist who will collaborate with team members to implement machine learning models leveraging data from sources across the sales and marketing pipeline. You will be joining a small, highly visible, analytics and operations team reporting into the CMO.







Primary Responsibilities




Use SQL and Python to build models leveraging data from multiple data sources across a multi-touch multi-contact organization-based customer journey
Explain model performance and provide recommendations for feature generation and selection to business users with limited experience in ML concepts
Build and deploy machine learning models leveraging packages like Scikit-learn and Pandas
Design reporting dashboards within Domo, our BI platform, following data visualization best practices
Identify gaps in processes and data collection to proactively ensure data quality across the marketing organization
Collaborate with fully remote teammates: communicating needs, coordinating work, and communicating timelines and deliverables across global time zones




Qualifications




BA in marketing, engineering, statistics, economics, computer science, or equivalent work experience
2+ years building and tuning machine learning models
2+ years working with B2B marketing data with an understanding of the lead journey, lead qualification processes, account-based marketing (ABM) metrics, and the marketing and sales pipeline
2+ years executing work as part of a project-based team (agile project management experience preferred)
1+ years working with Domo or 2+ years working with other BI platforms
Strong understanding of statistics and practical application of machine learning models
Ability to independently build, evaluate performance of, and tune machine learning models
Proficiency in Python; proficiency with git and version control; proficiency in working with APIs
Excellent interpersonal communication skills ‚Äì especially in the context of a fully-remote team and work environment
